Geriatric clients have lower body percentage of subcutaneous tissue. In order to avoid hitting an underlying bone when giving a subcutaneous injection, shorter needles are used and are injected at a 90-degree angle. If using a longer needle, it should be injected at a 45-degree angle. Aspiration of the plunger to check for blood return is not recommended anymore. Z-track method is recommended for intramuscular injections, not subcutaneous injection.
